- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce


```powershell
1..10 | ForEach-Object -Parallel { Get-Item NoSuchFile 2>$null; $? }
```

See symptoms below.

Note:

* The behavior seems related to the throttle limit (whose default is 5).

* `Start-ThreadJob` appears unaffected.


### Expected behavior

```console
False
False
False
False
False
False
False
False
False
False
```


### Actual behavior

```console
False
False
False
True
True
True
True
True
False
True
```


### Error details

_No response_

### Environment data

```powershell
PowerShell Core 7.3.0-preview.3
```

_No response_

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body:
This looks like an artifact of re-using runspaces, which is default behavior for performance.  Resetting a runspace state appears to leave the automatic success variable in a bad state.

```powershell
1..10 | ForEach-Object -Parallel { Get-Item NoSuchFile 2>$null; $? } -UseNewRunspace
```

title: The automatic success-status variable ($?) doesn't work properly in ForEach-Object -Parallel script blocks
